intro: Leucheria menana, commonly known as the slender mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in pairs along the stem. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are usually red or orange, containing one or two seeds each. Leucheria menana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it plays a role in the ecological interactions of its host species.
